question: What is the function of the noun clause in the following sentence: 'What she said surprised everyone'?
description: The noun clause 'What she said' acts as the subject of the verb 'surprised'. It tells us what did the action.

question: Identify the type of clause underlined: 'She will succeed *if she tries hard enough*.'
description: The clause 'if she tries hard enough' modifies the verb 'succeed' by telling under what condition she will succeed, making it an adverbial clause.

question: In the sentence 'The man who called earlier left a message,' what is the function of the relative clause 'who called earlier'?
options: B) It acts as the subject.
D) It serves as an object.
description: The relative clause 'who called earlier' provides additional information about 'the man', thus acting as an adjective clause.

question: What is the role of the subordinate clause in this sentence: 'Although she was tired, she continued to work'?
options: C) It contrasts with the main clause.
answer: C) It contrasts with the main clause.
description: The subordinate clause 'Although she was tired' contrasts with the main idea of the sentence, which is 'she continued to work.'

question: In 'I believe that he is honest,' the noun clause functions as which part of the sentence?
description: The noun clause 'that he is honest' acts as the direct object of the verb 'believe', explaining what is believed.

question: Which type of clause is underlined in the sentence: 'I will call you *as soon as I arrive home*.'?
description: The clause 'as soon as I arrive home' modifies the verb 'will call' by explaining when the action will happen, making it an adverbial clause.

question: In the sentence 'The book that you gave me is very interesting,' what is the function of 'that you gave me'?
options: B) It provides additional information about 'book'.
C) It serves as the subject of the sentence.
answer: B) It provides additional information about 'book'.
description: The relative clause 'that you gave me' describes the noun 'book' by telling us more about it.

question: What type of clause is 'wherever you go' in the sentence 'I will follow you wherever you go'?
description: The clause 'wherever you go' modifies the verb 'follow' by indicating the place, making it an adverbial clause of place.

question: Which of the following sentences contains a noun clause?
options: A) She sings because she loves music.
B) The person who called earlier left a message.
C) I don’t know what he wants.
D) We left when the concert ended.
answer: C) I don’t know what he wants.
description: The clause 'what he wants' is a noun clause functioning as the object of the verb 'know'.

question: What type of clause is 'before the meeting starts' in the sentence 'Let’s discuss the plan before the meeting starts'?
description: The clause 'before the meeting starts' modifies the verb 'discuss' by indicating time, making it an adverbial clause.

question: In 'The problem is that we don’t have enough time,' what is the role of the noun clause 'that we don’t have enough time'?
options: A) It serves as the subject.
B) It acts as the object.
C) It is a complement of the verb 'is'.
answer: C) It is a complement of the verb 'is'.
description: The clause 'that we don’t have enough time' completes the meaning of 'The problem is', making it a subject complement.

question: Identify the function of the adverbial clause in this sentence: 'We will leave when the show ends.'
options: C) It serves as the object of 'leave'.
D) It introduces a new idea.
description: The clause 'when the show ends' tells us the time of the action 'leave', making it an adverbial clause.

question: Which type of clause is underlined in the sentence: 'The house *where I grew up* is being renovated'?
description: The clause 'where I grew up' provides more information about 'house', acting as an adjective clause.

question: In 'What she decided surprised everyone,' what is the role of 'What she decided'?
description: The clause 'What she decided' acts as the subject of the sentence, identifying the thing that 'surprised everyone'.

question: What type of clause is 'because it was raining' in the sentence 'We stayed indoors because it was raining'?
description: The clause 'because it was raining' explains the reason for the action 'stayed', acting as an adverbial clause of reason.

question: In the sentence 'I wonder whether he’ll come,' what role does the noun clause 'whether he’ll come' play?
description: The noun clause 'whether he’ll come' functions as the object of the verb 'wonder', expressing what is being wondered.

question: Identify the relative clause in the sentence: 'The musician who performed last night was incredible.'
description: The relative clause 'who performed last night' provides more information about the noun 'musician'.

question: Which sentence contains a conditional clause?
options: A) I know that he’ll come.
B) If it rains, we will cancel the picnic.
C) She left because she was tired.
D) The man who called you left a message.
answer: B) If it rains, we will cancel the picnic.
description: The clause 'If it rains' expresses a condition under which the main clause will take place, making it a conditional clause.

question: In the sentence 'She’s happy that you came,' what type of clause is 'that you came'?
description: The clause 'that you came' functions as the object of the adjective 'happy', thus acting as a noun clause.

question: What is the role of the clause 'when the movie started' in 'We arrived when the movie started'?
options: B) It is the subject of the sentence.
C) It provides the reason for the arrival.
D) It is the object of 'arrived'.
description: The clause 'when the movie started' modifies the verb 'arrived' by telling us the time of arrival.

question: Which type of clause is underlined in this sentence: 'She knew *that he was lying*'?
description: The clause 'that he was lying' acts as the object of the verb 'knew', thus making it a noun clause.

question: In the sentence 'He left after the meeting ended,' what is the role of the clause 'after the meeting ended'?
options: A) It provides a reason for the action.
C) It indicates the time of the action.
D) It serves as a complement.
answer: C) It indicates the time of the action.
description: The clause 'after the meeting ended' modifies the verb 'left' by telling when the action occurred, making it an adverbial clause of time.

question: What is the function of the noun clause 'what she did' in the sentence 'I don’t understand what she did'?
description: The clause 'what she did' acts as the direct object of the verb 'understand'.

question: What type of clause is 'who lives next door' in the sentence 'The woman who lives next door is a doctor'?
description: The relative clause 'who lives next door' describes the noun 'woman', making it an adjective clause.

question: In the sentence 'It is important that you attend the meeting,' what role does the clause 'that you attend the meeting' play?
description: The noun clause 'that you attend the meeting' acts as a complement to the adjective 'important'.

question: Which of the following sentences contains a relative clause?
options: A) The book that I read was fascinating.
B) I hope you can come.
C) I don’t know what you’re saying.
D) She left because it was late.
answer: A) The book that I read was fascinating.
description: The clause 'that I read' provides more information about the noun 'book', making it a relative clause.

question: Identify the independent clause in the sentence: 'Because it was raining, we stayed indoors.'
description: The independent clause 'We stayed indoors' can stand alone as a complete sentence, while the other clause depends on it.

question: What is the function of 'who works at the library' in the sentence 'The man who works at the library is my friend'?
options: A) It provides additional information about 'man'.
B) It acts as the subject.
C) It serves as the verb complement.
D) It introduces a new idea.
answer: A) It provides additional information about 'man'.
description: The relative clause 'who works at the library' gives more information about 'the man', making it an adjective clause.

question: In the sentence 'She said that she would come tomorrow,' what type of clause is 'that she would come tomorrow'?
description: The clause 'that she would come tomorrow' functions as the object of the verb 'said', making it a noun clause.

question: Which of the following sentences contains an adverbial clause?
options: A) She wants to know where you are.
B) I’ll call you when I get home.
C) The person who helped me was kind.
D) What you said is true.
answer: B) I’ll call you when I get home.
description: The clause 'when I get home' modifies the verb 'call' by specifying the time, making it an adverbial clause.
